snippet: China’s president, Xi Jinping, made no reference to President Obama in a long, tightly scripted speech at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation meeting on Monday.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry replaces Pres Obama at the opening of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation meeting in Indonesia, leaving Chinese Pres Xi Jinping as the dominant leader at a gathering devoted to achieving greater economic integration; Obama canceled his trip to try to resolve the American government shutdown, and his absence is repeatedly noted.

byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ and JOE COCHRANE

lead_paragraph: China’s president, Xi Jinping, made no reference to President Obama in a long, tightly scripted speech at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation meeting on Monday.

headline.main: Obama’s Absence Leaves China as Dominant Force at Asia-Pacific Meeting
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Absence Leaves China as Dominant Force at Asia-Pacific Meeting
